Subject: Urgent: reorg interview process [OFFICIAL Internal Only]
Body:
Hi Helen,

 

In reading the latest communication between the PCS union and Ofgem today, I noticed the following statement:

 

We understand that Band C and D staff who exercise the option to apply for ring-fenced interviews and are not successful will go through the same redeployment and redundancy process as Band E and SCS. We believe that for these employees, the role they would have slotted into likely remains available, and hence ask Ofgem to give assurances that if unsuccessful, these staff will be slotted into these roles as if they had not opted to do a ring-fenced interview first.

 

Over and above my wish to progress in my career in Ofgem and given that my substantive role no longer exists or is yet to be determined, there is an expectation that I will interview to hold the interim role which I have been doing since the beginning of May. This leaves me no valid choice but to go for something with no guarantee of success and no assured fall-back position.

 

Can I ask you to push for clarification (if the above is incorrect) or adjustment (if it is correct) before I am left with a crucial decision which is actually a Hobson's choice?

 

Rory

 

[Internal Only]

Subject: RE: Urgent: reorg interview process [OFFICIAL Internal Only]
Body:
Hi Rory

 

I have enquired with HR and have the following response, which is in line with our discussions the last few weeks.

 

As Rory is in a temporary post, his ringfence rights are based on the grade and responsibilities of his substantive post, whether that substantive post still exists or not.

Where the substantive post doesn’t exist in the old or new structure, he should be mapped to a role at his substantive grade on a best fit basis. This is what we have done, in mapping him to a suitable band D role. There shouldn’t be any gain or detriment as part of the mapping process, so we are unable to map him to a more senior role. 

 

Does this clarify things for you?

 

Helen

Subject: RE: Quick question - how my current and possible future roles will be decided [OFFICIAL Internal Only]
Body:
Hi Laura and thanks for the chat Monday.

 

After reading the PCS document emailed to us this morning, specifically “D staff who exercise the option to apply for ring-fenced interviews and are not successful will go through the same redeployment and redundancy process”, I had a long back and forth email with my manager Helen Crooks (CDO and HoP for data) who called in and quoted HR on my questions to clarify the slot-in/interview process for my interim role.

 

Five points got clarified:

 

-      With respect to my Senior DBA role not existing to fall back into: “As Rory is in a temporary post, his ring-fence rights are based on the grade and responsibilities of his substantive post, whether that substantive post still exists or not.”

 

-      She had said previously that the HoPs would spend September role-mapping but this seems to have been already done according to IT: “This is what we have done, in mapping him to a suitable band D role.”

 

-      This slot-in may need to be interviewed for: “If someone else also maps in the next few weeks to the same D role then there will be an interview process.”

 

-      Confirmation of my interim status: “Rory is in a temporary post”

 

-      Most importantly, my question based on the above excerpt from consultation documents/feedback was whether I’d be at risk if not selected after interviewing for the E role I’m currently doing as interim: “you will slot in there if you are not successful for Head of.”

 

I pushed on this as it seemed to be the opposite of the stated policy above and could be interpreted as her opinion in an email and she replied: “ Given I have explicitly asked HR the point, I would take it that this is clarification of the redeployment process in this instance.”

 

There are still questions to be answered, like which new D role I’ve been mapped to, whether I have a choice on this, my grade mapping being stuck as 2c without taking the temp promotion into account, whether I can challenge this and if I can get paid for being in an interim E role since May (let alone what you and I discussed about SCS process) but this does seem to be some clarification.

 

I hope you can use this to clarify the general position and fill in some of the gaps in the consultation if it can be taken as policy rather than one person’s interpretation of policy albeit with written HR support.

 

As for taking it forward officially for myself and Chris, we are in the difficult position of waiting to see what career our manager / CDO / HoP maps out for us and whether she is on the interview panel that dictates our future. For now, we think we should wait but I’m still curious to know if policy has been followed with regards to what we discussed the other day.

 

As always thanks for your help in this,

Rory
